topics.body:
"@Kaz":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552ec2c76368727658cd0500#post_552ec2c76368727658cd0500
[bq="Kaz"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552ec0ca63687269417f0300#post_552ec0ca63687269417f0300

Unless it's going to the yiff territory, I think they're gender neutral, I dunno[/bq]
What's weird and totally unsurprising is that when fnaf at first became popular there was a massive spike on furry sites for activity.

Normally you would see furries go "ugh popular things are ruining the fandom", but I personally think they're enjoying the proxy spike in popularity because normally whenever a franchise about anthropomorphics come onto the scene the fans of the franchise go "eww furries are weird".  In this case it's a franchise about a child killer stuffing kids in suits and him getting killed and stuff in a suit; in this case if anything the fanart and porn is considerably more normal than all the gore fanart and the people that say they want to be in the suits.

Both fandoms are into some weird shit, but cause they're both into weird shit they've been getting along really well.
